TEXT.id: PaiwanCh2_012_THE TJAKUVUKUVUŁ MAN WHO CUT OFF HIS HAND
TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: namengeḍuq tua lima a se Tjakuvukuvuł (Qatsiłay village, p.178)

S.FORM: uzai aza marekałałak a masepatj.
ozai aza marekaljaljak a masepatj.
S.TRANSL: There was a family of four.

S.FORM: manu vaik a kina a sema kavuavuan.
mano vaik a kina a sema kavoavoan.
S.TRANSL: The mother went to the fields,

S.FORM: qau adjuqen azua kakeḍian a matjelu.
qao adjoqen azoa kakedrian a matjelo.
S.TRANSL: and left the three children.

S.FORM: qau kiłavaranan nua kina: "maya marivurivu," ayain, sa vaik a sema kavuavuan.
qao kiljavaranan noa kina: "maya marivorivo," ayain, sa vaik a sema kavoavoan.
S.TRANSL: She told them: “Don’t quarrel,” she said, and went to the fields.

S.FORM: manu liaw a sengsengan nua kina.
mano liaw a sengsengan noa kina.
S.TRANSL: She had a lot of work,

S.FORM: qau seleman anga aravats; qau qemauqaung anga a kakeḍian.
qao seleman anga aravac; qao qemaoqaong anga a kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: and it got very dark, and the children cried.

S.FORM: manu lemangda a se Tjakuvukuvuł.
mano lemangda a se Tjakovokovolj.
S.TRANSL: A Tjakuvukuvuł man heard them.

S.FORM: "nangaq a ku vaiken a keman," aya se Tjakuvukuvuł.
"nangaq a ko vaiken a keman," aya se Tjakovokovolj.
S.TRANSL: “I must go and eat (them),” he said.

S.FORM: qau vaiken sa tsagtsagi a siqełevan, sa "suqełevi," ayain azua kakeḍian.
qao vaiken sa cagcagi a siqeljevan, sa "soqeljevi," ayain azoa kakedrian.
S.TRANSL: He went there and knocked on the door, and said to the children: “Open the door.”

S.FORM: łakua ini suqełevi.
ljakoa ini soqeljevi.
S.TRANSL: But they didn’t open it.

S.FORM: remeqereq azua se Tjakuvukuvuł tu sema qumaqan.
remeqereq azoa se Tjakovokovolj to sema qomaqan.
S.TRANSL: The Tjakuvukuvuł man was determined (?) to get inside.

S.FORM: ini suqełevi angata.
ini soqeljevi angata.
S.TRANSL: They just wouldn’t open the door.

S.FORM: "ti tjaina aken.
"ti tjaina aken.
S.TRANSL: “I’m your mother;

S.FORM: pasa qumaqanu aken," ayain a ventsa.
pasa qomaqano aken," ayain a venca.
S.TRANSL: let me in,” he lied.

S.FORM: "nu ti kina sun, pasuksukan a su lima tutsu a berung," ayain.
"no ti kina son, pasoksokan a so lima toco a berong," ayain.
S.TRANSL: “If you are our mother, put your hand through this hole,” they told him.

S.FORM: qau sipasuksuk a paqulid a lima.
qao sipasoksok a paqolid a lima.
S.TRANSL: So he put his hand through.

S.FORM: mintu inika lima nua kina.
minto inika lima noa kina.
S.TRANSL: It wasn’t their mother’s hand.

S.FORM: qau kitjakałungan nua kakeḍian, sa muri vetseluqen.
qao kitjakaljongan noa kakedrian, sa mori veceloqen.
S.TRANSL: The children hung onto his hand, and it was going to break.

S.FORM: qau nuka viłviłen nazua se Tjakuvukuvuł ini anga maviłvił.
qao noka viljviljen nazoa se Tjakovokovolj ini anga maviljvilj.
S.TRANSL: Although the Tjakuvukuvuł man pulled it, he couldn’t pull it out.

S.FORM: qau kingeḍuqan anga a lima, sa kavilad anga.
qao kingedroqan anga a lima, sa kavilad anga.
S.TRANSL: So he cut off his hand and ran away.
